topic: How to document WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to document WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Documenting WebAssembly (WASM) Targets using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to document WebAssembly (WASM) targets using the FastAPI framework in Python 3.12+. It covers setting up the project, creating an endpoint for WASM files, and documenting the API.
key_points: Set up an endpoint to serve WASM files
Document the API using FastAPI's built-in features

code_examples.code: pip install fastapi uvicorn aiofiles websockets

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for this tutorial.
FastAPI version 0.70.0 or later is used.
caveats: Ensure that your WebAssembly files are in the correct format and properly named (e.g., main.wasm).
Make sure to test your endpoints thoroughly before deploying to production.
Keep in mind that FastAPI documentation is generated at runtime, so you may need to refresh the API documentation to see changes.
